details.description: First wife, married before he received prophethood. She was a wealthy widow and successful businesswoman.
children: four daughters and two sons, who died in infancy
details.additional_info: She passed away before the Hijra (migration to Medina).

details.description: Second wife, married after Khadijah's death. She was a widow and known for her humor and generosity.
Daughter of Abu Bakr, she was the only virgin he married and played a significant role in early Islamic history.
details.additional_info: Known for her intelligence and knowledge, she narrated many hadiths.

details.description: Daughter of Umar ibn al-Khattab, she was a widow before marrying the Prophet.
details.additional_info: Known for her piety and memorization of the Quran.

details.description: Known as 'Mother of the Poor' due to her charity work, she died only eight months after marrying the Prophet.
A widow with children, known for her wisdom and strong faith.
details.additional_info: Played a crucial role in the early Muslim community.

details.description: Former wife of Zayd ibn Harithah, her marriage to the Prophet highlighted important social reforms.
details.additional_info: She was known for her charity work.

details.description: Captured in a battle and then married the Prophet, her marriage led to the emancipation of many captives.
Daughter of Abu Sufyan, she converted to Islam and married the Prophet while in Abyssinia.
Jewish noblewoman captured in a battle, she married the Prophet and embraced Islam.
The last woman he married, known for her piety and devotion.
